Parallels Automation | revenue = [[United States dollar|US$]] 100 million (2008) [http://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601103&sid=aXGUX2luUUGY Parallels CEO Sees IPO in a Few Years, Not an Acquisition] | genre = [[Platform virtualization|Virtualization and Hosting Automation]] | homepage = [http://www.parallels.com/ parallels.com] }} '''Parallels, Inc.''' is a privately held [[Platform virtualization|virtualization]] technology company with offices in the USA, [[Germany]], [[UK]], [[France]], [[Japan]], [[China]], [[Russia]] and [[Ukraine]]. Parallels' US offices are in [[Renton, WA]]. The company has more than 700 employees as of 2010.http://www.parallels.com/eu/ Parallels, Inc. was an [[SWsoft]] company until January, 2008;[http://weblog.infoworld.com/virtualization/archives/2008/01/parallels_annou_5.html InfoWorld Virtualization Report | David Marshall | InfoWorld | Parallels Announces Virtuozzo Containers 4.0 | January 29, 2008 08:03 PM | By David Marshall] each company operated as a separate entity and maintained its own distinct branding. In December, 2007, Parallels' parent company SWsoft announced its plans to change its name to Parallels and ship both companies' products under the Parallels name.[http://www.theregister.co.uk/2007/12/12/swsoft_parallels_name_change/ SWsoft to abandon itself and become Parallels | The Register] The [[Mergers and acquisitions|merger]] was formalized in January 2008.[http://www.theregister.co.uk/2008/01/30/parallels_virtuozzo_containers_4point0/ SWsoft Parallels does Virtuozzo Containers 4.0 thing | The Register] == Company history == * 2004 â SWsoft acquires Parallels, Inc.[http://arstechnica.com/journals/apple.ars/2007/1/22/6709 Parallels acknowledges SWsoft ownership] * 2005 â Parallels, Inc. officially launches ** September 7 â Parallels launches beta version of Workstation for Windows and Linux 2.0[http://www.parallels.com/en/news/id,7915 SWsoft: :] ** December 8 - Parallels launches the completed version of [[Parallels Workstation]] for Windows and Linux 2.0http://www.parallels.com/en/news/id,8345 * 2006 - Parallels announces itself as an official company ** April 6 â Parallels launches its first beta build of [[Parallels Desktop for Mac]]http://www.parallels.com/en/news/id,8655 ** June 15 â Parallels officially launches Parallels Desktop for Machttp://www.parallels.com/en/news/id,9121 ** July 18 â Parallels Desktop for Mac debuts in retail storeshttp://www.parallels.com/en/news/id,9389 **September - Parallels moves its corporate headquarters from Herndon, Virginia to Renton, Washington * 2007 ** Netsys lawsuit (see [[Parallels Desktop for Mac#Netsys lawsuit|Parallels Desktop for Mac]] for details). ** June - Announces Parallels Server for Mac at [[WWDC]] ** April 26 - Announces Parallels Technology Network [http://www.computerworld.com/action/article.do?command=viewArticleBasic&articleId=9017923 Parallels Technology Network announced] * 2008 ** January - SWsoft merges into Parallels to become one company under the Parallels branding. ** January 11 - Parallels acquires ModernGigabyte, LLC.[http://www.thewhir.com/marketwatch/032708_Parallels_Acquires_ModernGigabyte.cfm Web Host Industry News | Parallels Acquires ModernGigabyte][http://www.parallels.com/modernbill Parallels.com | Parallels Acquires ModernGigabyte] ** June 17 - Parallels officially launches the first version of [[Parallels Server for Mac]][http://weblog.infoworld.com/virtualization/archives/2008/06/parallels_annou_6.html Virtualization Report | David Marshall | InfoWorld | Parallels announces the first Mac server virtualization platform | June 18, 2008 08:14 AM | David Marshall] ** September 1 - Parallels releases Parallels Desktop 4 for Windows and Linuxhttp://www.parallels.com/news/id,19933 ** November 11 - Parallels releases [[Parallels Desktop for Mac#Version_4.0|Parallels Desktop 4.0 for Mac]]http://www.parallels.com/news/id,16310 * 2009 ** November 4 - Parallels releases [[Parallels Desktop for Mac#Version_5|Parallels Desktop 5 for Mac]]http://www.parallels.com/news/id,20879 * 2010 ** September 14 - Parallels releases [[Parallels Desktop for Mac#Version_6|Parallels Desktop 6 for Mac]]http://www.parallels.com/news/id,24051 ==Products== Parallels uses [[Intel Core]]'s virtualization technology to allow the virtual machine direct access to the host computer's processor. Much of Parallels' software is based on a lightweight [[hypervisor]] architecture, which provides the guest operating system direct access to the computer's [[Computer hardware|hardware]]. Each Parallels [[virtual machine]] functions like a real computer with its own [[Central processing unit|processor]], [[RAM]], [[Floppy disk|floppy]], [[CD-ROM|CD drives]], [[harddrive]] and tools. ===Desktop software=== Parallels is best known for its [[AppleâIntel architecture|Intel-based Mac]] product [[Parallels Desktop for Mac]]. First released June 25, 2006, Parallels Desktop for Mac is a hardware emulation virtualization software that uses a lightweight [[hypervisor]] to enable users to run [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Linux]] and other operating systems simultaneously with [[Mac OS X]] on their Intel based Macs. First released December 8, 2005, [[Parallels Workstation]] enables users to create multiple, independent [[virtual machine]]s on one PC. Workstation consists of a virtual machine suite for [[Intel]] [[x86]]-compatible computers (running [[Microsoft Windows]] or [[Linux]]), which allows the simultaneous creation and execution of multiple x86 virtual machines. Workstation supports [[hardware-assisted virtualization|hardware]] [[x86 virtualization]] technologies such as [[Intel VT-x]]. ===Server software=== First release June 17, 2008, [[Parallels Server for Mac]] is a hypervisor-based server virtualization software that enables IT managers to run multiple Windows, Linux and [[Mac OS X Server]] operating systems on a single Mac Xserve.[http://www.computerworld.com/action/article.do?command=viewArticleBasic&articleId=9024859 Parallels demos Mac server virtualization] As of its release, it is currently the only server virtualization solution for the Mac OS X server platform and that allows users to virtualize Mac OS X Leopard Server. Parallels Virtuozzo Containers is an [[operating system-level virtualization]] product designed for large-scale homogeneous [[Server (computing)|server]] environments and [[data center]]s. Parallels Virtuozzo Containers is compatible with [[x86]], [[x86-64]] and [[IA-64]] platforms. Parallels Virtuozzo Containers was first released under Parallels' former parent company [[SWsoft]]. The Linux version was released in 2001 while the Windows version was released in 2005. ===Automation software=== [[Plesk|Parallels Plesk Control Panel]] allows a server [[system administrator|administrator]] to set up new [[website]]s, [[e-mail]] accounts, and [[Domain name system|DNS]] entries through a friendly [[web browser|web]]-based interface. Parallels Plesk Control Panel for [[Linux distributions|Linux]]/[[Unix-like|UNIX]] supports multiple [[POSIX]] platforms, including [[Red Hat Linux]]/[[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], [[SUSE Linux distributions|SUSE]], [[Debian]]/[[Ubuntu Linux|Ubuntu]] and [[FreeBSD]]. Parallels Plesk Control Panel for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] supports [[Windows 2003|Windows Server 2003]] and [[Windows 2008|Windows Server 2008]] operating systems. Parallels Automation System allows businesses to increase productivity and revenue by automating billing and provisioning of their services. Parallels Plesk Operation Auatomation is an enterprise solution/platform for Hosting Providers which automates provisioning of new hosting subscriptions to the hardware. Supports provisioning of Apache and IIS hosted websites, VPS hosting, Qmail, Open-Xchange and MS Exchange for mail hosting, as well as supports Sharepoint, Dynamics CRM, email filtering and Global Relay email archiving & compliance. Hosting Vendor adds new hardware nodes into POA infrastructure and basing on configuration templates sets up provisioning of Customer's Subscriptions to the new hardware. Parallels Business Automation - Enterprise is an enterprise billing platform usually used along with POA to manage and automate billing for services provisioned through POA. Allows to configure the Store, Service Plans with prices, discounts, promotions. Supports registration of domains by means of number of special plugins. Might be used as billing engine for any other platform via API integration. == See also == * [[Comparison of platform virtual machines]] for a list of related virtualization software products * [[Hypervisor]] * [[Operating system-level virtualization]] * [[Virtual appliance]] * [[Virtual machine]] * [[Platform virtualization|Virtualization]] * [[x86 virtualization]] * [[Virtual disk image]] == References == {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://www.parallels.com Parallels, Inc.] * [http://www.enterprisedesktopalliance.com/ Enterprise Desktop Alliance] [[Category:Companies established in 1997]] [[Category:Software companies of the United States]] [[Category:Virtualization software]] [[Category:Proprietary software]] [[Category:Privately held companies of Switzerland]] [[de:Parallels (Unternehmen)]] [[ko:íë¬ë´ì¦]] [[it:Parallels (azienda)]] [[ja:Parallels]] [[ru:Parallels]]
